title: Michael Cera Spends $2.4 Million on a Brooklyn Townhouse
text:
With his Broadway career flourishing, Canadian actor Michael Cera will likely spend more time in New York, after snapping up a $2.4 million townhouse in Brooklyn.



Mr. Cera, 31, used a limited liability company to close the deal earlier this month for the Bedford–Stuyvesant home, according to people familiar with the sale and property records filed with the city registry Tuesday. He entered into contract to buy the property in June, just a few weeks after it hit the market.



From Penta Anthony Bourdain’s Personal Property Hits Auction

Mr. Cera starred in the sitcom “Arrested Development,” in its original iteration from 2003-06 and its 2018-19 reboot; and in movies such as 2007’s “Juno” and “Superbad,” 2010’s “Scott Pilgrim vs. the World” and 2017’s “The Lego Batman Movie.” In 2014, he made his Broadway debut in the production of Kenneth Lonergan's “This Is Our Youth.”



Mr. Cera was nominated for the Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Play for his performance in 2018 “Lobby Hero.”



Mr. Cera’s rep declined to confirm or comment on the transaction. According to a source familiar with the deal, he was behind the limited liability company.



Listing agent Nadine Adamson of Brown Harris Stevens handled the sale. It wasn’t clear who represented Mr. Cera as a buyer’s agent.



The townhouse on a tree-lined street in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Bedford–Stuyvesant is charming and move-in-ready, according to the listing with Brown Harris Stevens. The four-story townhouse, built in 1899, retains some of its original details, including wide plank floors, marble mantles, and mahogany staircase railing and banister.



The townhouse can be used as two units. The upper triplex has four bedrooms and two bathrooms with access to the landscaped garden through a terrace. There is also a one-bed, one-bath apartment on the garden level, according to the listing.
